issue.title: CSS : z-index ignored because of translate3d with an HTML structure generated by the libraries javascript fullpagejs and animejs
issue.body:
### Description ### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS https://codepen.io/kegilkoo/pen/OJERXwb ### Steps to reproduce it I create a simple personal website using the libraries [fullpagejs][1] and [animejs][2]. The website shows a set of slides (by means of fullpagejs), and I want to add an absolute overlay to the top of each slides. The height of the overlay must be increased if I scroll to the next slide, and the next slide, etc.. [![enter image description here][3]][3] v and if I swipe to the next slide v [![enter image description here][4]][4] The height of the overlay grows with an animation (with animejs). In some slides, I add some elements and sometimes, one of these element may be over the overlay. (by example the element A bellow) [![enter image description here][5]][5] But ! and this is my issue, the element A is behind the overlay, not over as expected : [![enter image description here][6]][6] After a while and some lost hairs, I find the issue. Here is a simplified code : ```html
``` ([link codepen][7]) In the result, the orange square is behind the blue overlay and **this is because** the css properties `transform: translate3d...` and `transition: transform...` automatically added by fullpagejs. [![enter image description here][8]][8] Because theses properties, the property `z-index` is ignored ! If you remove theses problematics properties then the property `z-index` work well and the orange element become over the overlay as I want After somes searches and somes tries I don't find a way for have blocks elements inner a slide block and blocks elements over the overlay... Thanks for any help ! [1]: https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/ [2]: https://animejs.com/ [3]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/eREIW.png [4]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/YkY1I.png [5]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/6mr5A.png [6]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/KyZqD.png [7]: https://codepen.io/kegilkoo/pen/OJERXwb [8]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/O959O.png [9]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5472802/css-z-index-lost-after-webkit-transform-translate3d ### Versions Tested on Chrome and Firefox browsers

comment.body:
This is not really a fullPage.js issue but probably a bug in the browser/s dealing with `translate3d` transformations and `z-index`.

See [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5472802/css-z-index-lost-after-webkit-transform-translate3d).

You can try some things like adding `transform-style: preserve-3d;`.

Another way to fix it is by creating the elements outside the fullPage.js structure.

And probably the simplest one, turning of `css3` transitions on fullPage.js by using `css3:false` or `scrollBar: true`.

issue.title: CSS Alternative

comment.body:
CSS snap is just a **single feature** within fullPage.js.
By taking a look at [the fullPage.js documentation](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/) you should be able to spot the difference :) 

One of the main differences is that fullpage.js is able to force the automatic slide of sections, while CSS snaps works on a free scroll and only animates once the user has ended up scrolling. This can lead to the user sliding multiple sections at the same time online with fullPage.js. It also creates a less-than-ideal scenario when using a mouse wheel instead of a trackpad to scroll.

Apart from that, fullPage.js is a well-tested component that comes with **plenty of features** that will **save you a TON of work** when working with a full-screen page.

Things like:

## [fullPage.js callbacks](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#callbacks).

Giving developers **total control** over when to trigger certain actions.
Things can be as complex as:

- If the user has been on section 1 let the user scrolls 3 times - using the mouse wheel - without triggering any animation (we might want to trigger our own in-slide effects), then scroll down and trigger the text animation 2 seconds after the user lands on it. Once done, disable scrolling up by mouse, trackpad, and keyboard. 
- When the user scrolls 150pixels within the scrollable, container of section 2, then move to section 5 and slide 3, and do it with no animation. 

## [fullPage.js methods](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#methods)

Allowing developers to trigger specific actions, such as moving to a specific horizontal slide within a vertical section, locking the scroll direction, the keyboard or setting responsive mode resulting in the free scroll, turning horizontal slides into vertical ones, or allowing sections to be bigger than he viewport only in this mode.

## [fullPage.js state classes](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#state-classes-added-by-fullpagejs)

fullPage.js comes with state classes out of the box. This means you can create CSS conditions to style or animate elements, or even use these classes to know the state your website is currently in.

Small details that will make your life way easier when creating a website. Things that you would have to create from the scratch otherwise.

## [fullPage.js options](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#options)

Offering thousands of possible combinations and saving a huge amount of time configuring things like:

- Horizontal arrows to slide right left.
- Navigation bullets & tooltips in sections and horizontal slides.
- Menu linked with sections
- Defining anchors on the URL (and making them linkable)
- Defining history behavior when going back/forward in browser history
- Defining the easing effect 
- Loop options / inifite scroll
- Keyboard scroll 
- Allowing scroll within overflowing sections
- Defining responsive thresholds 
- Lazy load
- And enabling plenty of [fullPage.js extensions](http://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/)

And all of them tied perfectly together, so for example, if scrolling is disabled, clicking on a menu item won't allow the user the scroll to that section, the URL anchor won't change, no callbacks will get fired etc.

### Additional out-of-the-box features

On top of that, fullPage.js allows you to:

- Play/pause media elements when entering/leaving a section.
- Define non-full-screen sections (larger or smaller, which by the way, [is a problem with CSS snaps](https://alvarotrigo.com/blog/why-not-to-use-css-scroll-snap/))
- Add mouse dragging, which is not even an option on CSS snaps.
- Define scrollable sections 
- Use a "normal page" after fullpage.js so once you are done with the full-screen sections you can have your usual page.
- fullPage.js automatically detects changes on the DOM and updates accordingly, without even needing to call any method or use any sophisticated framework.
- Detect the trigger that fired the scroll (trackpad, keyboard, bullet, menu, arrows...)

### Ready for frameworks

It's also available as a component for [jQuery](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#initialization-with-jquery), [React](https://alvarotrigo.com/react-fullpage/), [Vue](https://alvarotrigo.com/vue-fullpage/) and [Angular](https://alvarotrigo.com/angular-fullpage/).

Making it easier to track the state of the website on the JS side too.

### Ready for WordPress

It can also be added as a WordPress plugin for [Elementor](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-elementor/), [Gutenberg](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-gutenberg/), and soon [Divi](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-divi/) builders. 

It makes it super easy to integrate, configure and use any possible fullPage.js extensions.

----

So, as you can see, CSS snaps can be ok to perform certain kinds of websites, but it won't be offering the same fullPage.js. does.

fullPage.js is a component that **makes sure developers can focus on creating beautiful and completely functional websites** and not on the effect itself. 

It takes away from developers the task of creating such things from the scratch and making sure they are fully functional and compatible with all kinds of devices. 

If you need it or not, completely depends on your needs.

comment.body:
You are loading the wrong version for the CSS file.
Replace this:

```html
	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="https://unpkg.com/fullpage.js@3.0.1/dist/fullpage.min.css">
``` 

For version 4.0.12

```html
	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="https://unpkg.com/fullpage.js@4.0.12/dist/fullpage.min.css">
```

issue.title: Position TOC within article content - After first paragraph
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

It's common to find the table of contents after one or two introductory paragraphs. 
I believe this is yet not possible with this plugin.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

It'd be nice to be able to add on our markdown files some indicator of where we want the table to get added.
Something like

```markdown
paragraph
paragraph

{{ TOC }}

paragraph
paragraph
```

comment.body: Perhaps there's a way but creating a `addLiquidShortcode` and calling some of the plugin functions directly there?

issue.title: Elementor - Background Overlay Appearance Delayed When Scrolling (Safari)
issue.body:
### Description
During our testing Safari on Desktop and iOS is showing graphical bugs that don't appear on other platforms. 

VIDEO OF ISSUES: https://youtu.be/wd66gT6Nh4U

- Home Page: Background Overlays appear after a delay of coming into view. There is no animation applied to them.
- Flip Card's freak out on hover, no other way to describe it. You can see it in the "Engines" section on the home page and on the team members on the "About" page
- Games Page: Slider flashes white when scrolling
- Games Page: Lightbox background doesn't animate smoothly in when clicking on a game box art

These things seem to all be related to Safari's animation issues. I can mitigate some of the issues by using the "transform: translateZ(0)" hack, which I have done on the Flip Cards on the live site. It does not seem to work on the background overlays.

Are there any suggestions?

### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS
[Ideally in jsfiddle.net (https://jsfiddle.net/alvarotrigo/ea17skjr) or codepen.io (https://codepen.io/alvarotrigo/pen/NxyPPp), links to personal websites won't be reviewed unless isolated. Reported issues without a reproduction might get closed.]

### Steps to reproduce it
1. Enable Fullpage.js in Elementor
2. Add a background image to two sections
3. Add a gradient overlay over each section
4. Scroll between sections
5. Notice the background overlay doesn't appear until after a delay in Safari, but is fine on other browsers.

### Versions 
Safari 16, Mac OSX 12.6, reported on iOS as well (I don't have an iOS device.)

issue.title: Loading page with anchors shows wrong section/slide when using scrollOverflow
issue.body: When loading a page using URL anchors, the destination section/slide won't be the correct one due to fullpage.js focusing on the scrollOverflow element (or section/slide if there's none present).

issue.title: Loading page with anchors shows wrong section/slide when using scrollOverflow
issue.body: When loading a page using URL anchors, the destination section/slide won't be the correct one due to fullpage.js focusing on the scrollOverflow element (or section/slide if there's none present).

comment.body: Fixed in version 4.0.10! 🥳

issue.title: Android : Slider + Form inputs  + " fullpage_api.movex()" strange behavior
issue.body:
### Description

Hello, i bought a licence few months ago and played around your amazing plugin. Eveyrthing went well, i was able to achieve almost everything i needed/asked to.


Using 4.0.7 I had problem with blank screen issue on input focus (only on mobile), so i checked issues on github and saw people had the same one, and that the plugin got updated, i decided to upgrade to 4.0.11.


Now when i tried to make a single/multiple form using implemented slider, i have a really strange behavior, after filling the second input, i can't use fullpage_api.moveSlideLeft(); neither the arrows nor the nav 


## Tests & devices : fullpage.js v4.0.10
 
Desktop : As intended



lambdatest   : iphone12 emulator : as intended

android emulator : issue.
4  android phone : issue.

## fulllpage v4.0.7

Android : Weird input white screen/scrolling on input focus, but no issue with  fullpage_api.movex() after second input.
Desktop : As intended


### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS


I tried to isolate this behaviour on a blank v4.0.11 

uploaded on personal hosting

https://gamx.fr/fullpagetestinput/examples/active-slide.html#secondPage/1


### Steps to reproduce it

On android : (if someone can test on real iphones and tell me if it's working as intended like on my emulator)

1.Fill an input (first or seconde slide , it dosen't matter.
2. Press Next/Prev 
3. It goes well.
4. fill the second input, press next/prev
5. everything is locked, button doesn't fire, nor the arrow keys or nav buttons


I hope this is a cronstructive issue and that i didn't miss something stupid 🗡️ 

I really appreciate  your work,. Thanks for taking a look at it :)

issue.title: Auto Height Section Issue When Auto Scrolling Off
issue.body:
Hi,

When `autoScrolling` is `false`, `min-height` conflicts with `height` in CSS when auto height is enabled on a section. So even if the section is auto height, it behaves as full height.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16402717/193471496-85de8cbd-dc78-4d11-ac1e-9a34c7e1af73.png)

https://codepen.io/meceware/pen/MWGGqLb

A solution might be solved with setting the CSS selectors as `:not(.fp-auto-height)`.

Thank you,

issue.title: Auto Height Sections Minimum Height Issue on Dev Branch
issue.body:
Hi,

I would like to ask, there was no `min-height` attribute in [`.fp-auto-height`](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/blob/3.1.2/dist/fullpage.css#L215) on the previous versions, but with the dev branch after `v4.0.11`, `min-height` attribute is added to `.fp-auto-height`.

I think this issue is related to [#4467](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467). In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

Thank you,

issue.title: “scrollBar:true” impacts performance/FPS • fixed/sticky elements inside “fullpage” wrapper
issue.body:
Hi guys!

I’m using Webflow and creating a website for a client with FullPage.js.

I just wanted to ask why “scrollBar: true” impacts performance so much? FPS drops quite substantially. I’ve checked other websites with “scrollBar: true” like the demo one by Alvaro and another one that I’ll mention below.

That being said, the website is so smooth without “scrollBar: true”.

Is there a fix for the performance issues? Sadly, “position: fixed” doesn’t work inside “fullpage” wrapper without “scrollBar: true”. I needed it to create an animation.

Basically, I want the same “sticky” effect as in the “second” section of [this website (made in Webflow too)](https://beauty-hunter-project.webflow.io/). I’m really scratching my head here trying to understand how to create it :(

Hi there!

I have a Next.js build using custom validation to control the user's movement between sections. (it's a quiz)

The problem is that when the page is refreshed, all state data is lost breaking the dynamic content generated based on interactions in previous sections. I'd like it so that when the user refreshes their browser, they are returned to #Section1

Cheers!

issue.title: Auto Height Sections Minimum Height Issue on Dev Branch
issue.body:
Hi,

I would like to ask, there was no `min-height` attribute in [`.fp-auto-height`](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/blob/3.1.2/dist/fullpage.css#L215) on the previous versions, but with the dev branch after `v4.0.11`, `min-height` attribute is added to `.fp-auto-height`.

I think this issue is related to [#4467](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467). In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

Thank you,

comment.body:
@davITnemec you can use the fullPage.js option `scrollOverflow: false` to solve the issue if you are not planning on using scrollable sections with content larger than the viewport.

Otherwise, notice the `fp-overflow` is not a flex element and it's not taking 100% height of the viewport. 
So in this case you'll have to go another route.

I'd probably use an absolute positioned element to place the item on every bottom of the section.

issue.title: Auto Height Section Issue When Auto Scrolling Off
issue.body:
Hi,

When `autoScrolling` is `false`, `min-height` conflicts with `height` in CSS when auto height is enabled on a section. So even if the section is auto height, it behaves as full height.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16402717/193471496-85de8cbd-dc78-4d11-ac1e-9a34c7e1af73.png)

https://codepen.io/meceware/pen/MWGGqLb

A solution might be solved with setting the CSS selectors as `:not(.fp-auto-height)`.

Thank you,

The height of the overlay must be increased if I scroll to the next slide, and the next slide, etc.. In some slides, I add some elements and sometimes, one of these element may be over the overlay. (by example the element A bellow) [![enter image description here][5]][5] But ! and this is my issue, the element A is behind the overlay, not over as expected : [![enter image description here][6]][6] After a while and some lost hairs, I find the issue. Here is a simplified code : ```html
``` ([link codepen][7]) In the result, the orange square is behind the blue overlay and **this is because** the css properties `transform: translate3d...` and `transition: transform...` automatically added by fullpagejs. [![enter image description here][8]][8] Because theses properties, the property `z-index` is ignored ! If you remove theses problematics properties then the property `z-index` work well and the orange element become over the overlay as I want After somes searches and somes tries I don't find a way for have blocks elements inner a slide block and blocks elements over the overlay... Thanks for any help ! [1]: https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/ [2]: https://animejs.com/ [3]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/eREIW.png [4]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/YkY1I.png [5]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/6mr5A.png [6]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/KyZqD.png [7]: https://codepen.io/kegilkoo/pen/OJERXwb [8]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/O959O.png [9]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5472802/css-z-index-lost-after-webkit-transform-translate3d ### Versions Tested on Chrome and Firefox browsers

comment.body:
This is not really a fullPage.js issue but probably a bug in the browser/s dealing with `translate3d` transformations and `z-index`.

See [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5472802/css-z-index-lost-after-webkit-transform-translate3d).

You can try some things like adding `transform-style: preserve-3d;`.

Another way to fix it is by creating the elements outside the fullPage.js structure.

And probably the simplest one, turning of `css3` transitions on fullPage.js by using `css3:false` or `scrollBar: true`.

issue.title: CSS Alternative

comment.body:
CSS snap is just a **single feature** within fullPage.js.
By taking a look at [the fullPage.js documentation](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/) you should be able to spot the difference :) 

One of the main differences is that fullpage.js is able to force the automatic slide of sections, while CSS snaps works on a free scroll and only animates once the user has ended up scrolling. This can lead to the user sliding multiple sections at the same time online with fullPage.js. It also creates a less-than-ideal scenario when using a mouse wheel instead of a trackpad to scroll.

Apart from that, fullPage.js is a well-tested component that comes with **plenty of features** that will **save you a TON of work** when working with a full-screen page.

Things like:

## [fullPage.js callbacks](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#callbacks).

Giving developers **total control** over when to trigger certain actions.
Things can be as complex as:

- If the user has been on section 1 let the user scrolls 3 times - using the mouse wheel - without triggering any animation (we might want to trigger our own in-slide effects), then scroll down and trigger the text animation 2 seconds after the user lands on it. Once done, disable scrolling up by mouse, trackpad, and keyboard. 
- When the user scrolls 150pixels within the scrollable, container of section 2, then move to section 5 and slide 3, and do it with no animation. 

## [fullPage.js methods](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#methods)

Allowing developers to trigger specific actions, such as moving to a specific horizontal slide within a vertical section, locking the scroll direction, the keyboard or setting responsive mode resulting in the free scroll, turning horizontal slides into vertical ones, or allowing sections to be bigger than he viewport only in this mode.

## [fullPage.js state classes](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#state-classes-added-by-fullpagejs)

fullPage.js comes with state classes out of the box. This means you can create CSS conditions to style or animate elements, or even use these classes to know the state your website is currently in.

Small details that will make your life way easier when creating a website. Things that you would have to create from the scratch otherwise.

## [fullPage.js options](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#options)

Offering thousands of possible combinations and saving a huge amount of time configuring things like:

- Horizontal arrows to slide right left.
- Navigation bullets & tooltips in sections and horizontal slides.
- Menu linked with sections
- Defining anchors on the URL (and making them linkable)
- Defining history behavior when going back/forward in browser history
- Defining the easing effect 
- Loop options / inifite scroll
- Keyboard scroll 
- Allowing scroll within overflowing sections
- Defining responsive thresholds 
- Lazy load
- And enabling plenty of [fullPage.js extensions](http://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/)

And all of them tied perfectly together, so for example, if scrolling is disabled, clicking on a menu item won't allow the user the scroll to that section, the URL anchor won't change, no callbacks will get fired etc.

### Additional out-of-the-box features

On top of that, fullPage.js allows you to:

- Play/pause media elements when entering/leaving a section.
- Define non-full-screen sections (larger or smaller, which by the way, [is a problem with CSS snaps](https://alvarotrigo.com/blog/why-not-to-use-css-scroll-snap/))
- Add mouse dragging, which is not even an option on CSS snaps.
- Define scrollable sections 
- Use a "normal page" after fullpage.js so once you are done with the full-screen sections you can have your usual page.
- fullPage.js automatically detects changes on the DOM and updates accordingly, without even needing to call any method or use any sophisticated framework.
- Detect the trigger that fired the scroll (trackpad, keyboard, bullet, menu, arrows...)

### Ready for frameworks

It's also available as a component for [jQuery](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#initialization-with-jquery), [React](https://alvarotrigo.com/react-fullpage/), [Vue](https://alvarotrigo.com/vue-fullpage/) and [Angular](https://alvarotrigo.com/angular-fullpage/).

Making it easier to track the state of the website on the JS side too.

### Ready for WordPress

It can also be added as a WordPress plugin for [Elementor](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-elementor/), [Gutenberg](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-gutenberg/), and soon [Divi](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-divi/) builders. 

It makes it super easy to integrate, configure and use any possible fullPage.js extensions.

----

So, as you can see, CSS snaps can be ok to perform certain kinds of websites, but it won't be offering the same fullPage.js. does.

fullPage.js is a component that **makes sure developers can focus on creating beautiful and completely functional websites** and not on the effect itself. 

It takes away from developers the task of creating such things from the scratch and making sure they are fully functional and compatible with all kinds of devices. 

If you need it or not, completely depends on your needs.

issue.title: Elementor - Background Overlay Appearance Delayed When Scrolling (Safari)
issue.body:
### Description
During our testing Safari on Desktop and iOS is showing graphical bugs that don't appear on other platforms. 

VIDEO OF ISSUES: https://youtu.be/wd66gT6Nh4U

- Home Page: Background Overlays appear after a delay of coming into view. There is no animation applied to them.
- Flip Card's freak out on hover, no other way to describe it. You can see it in the "Engines" section on the home page and on the team members on the "About" page
- Games Page: Slider flashes white when scrolling
- Games Page: Lightbox background doesn't animate smoothly in when clicking on a game box art

These things seem to all be related to Safari's animation issues. I can mitigate some of the issues by using the "transform: translateZ(0)" hack, which I have done on the Flip Cards on the live site. It does not seem to work on the background overlays.

Are there any suggestions?

### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS
[Ideally in jsfiddle.net (https://jsfiddle.net/alvarotrigo/ea17skjr) or codepen.io (https://codepen.io/alvarotrigo/pen/NxyPPp), links to personal websites won't be reviewed unless isolated. Reported issues without a reproduction might get closed.]

### Steps to reproduce it
1. Enable Fullpage.js in Elementor
2. Add a background image to two sections
3. Add a gradient overlay over each section
4. Scroll between sections
5. Notice the background overlay doesn't appear until after a delay in Safari, but is fine on other browsers.

### Versions 
Safari 16, Mac OSX 12.6, reported on iOS as well (I don't have an iOS device.)

issue.title: Android : Slider + Form inputs  + " fullpage_api.movex()" strange behavior
issue.body:
### Description

Hello, i bought a licence few months ago and played around your amazing plugin. Eveyrthing went well, i was able to achieve almost everything i needed/asked to.


Using 4.0.7 I had problem with blank screen issue on input focus (only on mobile), so i checked issues on github and saw people had the same one, and that the plugin got updated, i decided to upgrade to 4.0.11.


Now when i tried to make a single/multiple form using implemented slider, i have a really strange behavior, after filling the second input, i can't use fullpage_api.moveSlideLeft(); neither the arrows nor the nav 


## Tests & devices : fullpage.js v4.0.10
 
Desktop : As intended



lambdatest   : iphone12 emulator : as intended

android emulator : issue.
4  android phone : issue.

## fulllpage v4.0.7

Android : Weird input white screen/scrolling on input focus, but no issue with  fullpage_api.movex() after second input.
Desktop : As intended


### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS


I tried to isolate this behaviour on a blank v4.0.11 

uploaded on personal hosting

https://gamx.fr/fullpagetestinput/examples/active-slide.html#secondPage/1


### Steps to reproduce it

On android : (if someone can test on real iphones and tell me if it's working as intended like on my emulator)

1.Fill an input (first or seconde slide , it dosen't matter.
2. Press Next/Prev 
3. It goes well.
4. fill the second input, press next/prev
5. everything is locked, button doesn't fire, nor the arrow keys or nav buttons


I hope this is a cronstructive issue and that i didn't miss something stupid 🗡️ 

I really appreciate  your work,. Thanks for taking a look at it :)

issue.title: Auto Height Section Issue When Auto Scrolling Off
issue.body:
Hi,

When `autoScrolling` is `false`, `min-height` conflicts with `height` in CSS when auto height is enabled on a section. So even if the section is auto height, it behaves as full height.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16402717/193471496-85de8cbd-dc78-4d11-ac1e-9a34c7e1af73.png)

https://codepen.io/meceware/pen/MWGGqLb

A solution might be solved with setting the CSS selectors as `:not(.fp-auto-height)`.

Thank you,

issue.title: Auto Height Sections Minimum Height Issue on Dev Branch
issue.body:
Hi,

I would like to ask, there was no `min-height` attribute in [`.fp-auto-height`](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/blob/3.1.2/dist/fullpage.css#L215) on the previous versions, but with the dev branch after `v4.0.11`, `min-height` attribute is added to `.fp-auto-height`.

I think this issue is related to [#4467](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467). In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

Thank you,

issue.title: “scrollBar:true” impacts performance/FPS • fixed/sticky elements inside “fullpage” wrapper
issue.body:
Hi guys!

I’m using Webflow and creating a website for a client with FullPage.js.

I just wanted to ask why “scrollBar: true” impacts performance so much? FPS drops quite substantially. I’ve checked other websites with “scrollBar: true” like the demo one by Alvaro and another one that I’ll mention below.

That being said, the website is so smooth without “scrollBar: true”.

Is there a fix for the performance issues? Sadly, “position: fixed” doesn’t work inside “fullpage” wrapper without “scrollBar: true”. I needed it to create an animation.

Basically, I want the same “sticky” effect as in the “second” section of [this website (made in Webflow too)](https://beauty-hunter-project.webflow.io/). I’m really scratching my head here trying to understand how to create it :(

issue.title: Auto Height Sections Minimum Height Issue on Dev Branch
issue.body:
Hi,

I would like to ask, there was no `min-height` attribute in [`.fp-auto-height`](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/blob/3.1.2/dist/fullpage.css#L215) on the previous versions, but with the dev branch after `v4.0.11`, `min-height` attribute is added to `.fp-auto-height`.

I think this issue is related to [#4467](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467). In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

Thank you,

comment.body:
> That's right! The new Elementor configuration adds the min-height directly to the section. It wasn't there before so the old versions work with both updates however with the latest Elementor update, min-height seems to conflict.

Right, now I get it :)

I would like to ask, there was no `min-height` attribute in [`.fp-auto-height`](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/blob/3.1.2/dist/fullpage.css#L215) on the previous versions, but with the dev branch after `v4.0.11`, `min-height` attribute is added to `.fp-auto-height`.

I think this issue is related to [#4467](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467). In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

Thank you,

Perhaps I'm not getting the scenario you are referring to, but on the codepens I provided the result is the same in V3 and V4, right?

comment.body:
> I think this issue is related to https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467.

I think on this issue the user expects the `fp-overflow` element to take the height of the section, but that's not how it works right now. 
I believe that's an issue regarding the ScrollOverflow feature more than the `fp-auto-height`.


> In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

So, we are talking about when the developer decides to use `min-height` to set the height, right? 
Because if he uses `height`, he would also have to use ` !important` to overwrite the fullpage.js value for `fp-auto-height`.
Is this related in any way to WP plugins?

With v4.0.12 (dev branch)

issue.title: Auto Height Section Issue When Auto Scrolling Off
issue.body:
Hi,

When `autoScrolling` is `false`, `min-height` conflicts with `height` in CSS when auto height is enabled on a section. So even if the section is auto height, it behaves as full height.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16402717/193471496-85de8cbd-dc78-4d11-ac1e-9a34c7e1af73.png)

https://codepen.io/meceware/pen/MWGGqLb

A solution might be solved with setting the CSS selectors as `:not(.fp-auto-height)`.

Thank you,

comment.body:
I haven't checked the page as I only check isolated reproductions here on Github.
But I the `fp-overflow` element is not suppose to be 100% height. 

If you want it to be 100vh, then add any element on it with such property `height: 100vh`.

The change you got on your page is totally normal as you are using a CDN that always loads the latest version, so your page can be subject to these kind of things.

comment.body:
@davITnemec you can use the fullPage.js option `scrollOverflow: false` to solve the issue if you are not planning on using scrollable sections with content larger than the viewport.

Otherwise, notice the `fp-overflow` is not a flex element and it's not taking 100% height of the viewport. 
So in this case you'll have to go another route.

I'd probably use an absolute positioned element to place the item on every bottom of the section.

issue.title: CSS : z-index ignored because of translate3d with an HTML structure generated by the libraries javascript fullpagejs and animejs
issue.body:
### Description ### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS https://codepen.io/kegilkoo/pen/OJERXwb ### Steps to reproduce it I create a simple personal website using the libraries [fullpagejs][1] and [animejs][2]. The website shows a set of slides (by means of fullpagejs), and I want to add an absolute overlay to the top of each slides. The height of the overlay must be increased if I scroll to the next slide, and the next slide, etc.. [![enter image description here][3]][3] v and if I swipe to the next slide v [![enter image description here][4]][4] The height of the overlay grows with an animation (with animejs). In some slides, I add some elements and sometimes, one of these element may be over the overlay. (by example the element A bellow) [![enter image description here][5]][5] But ! and this is my issue, the element A is behind the overlay, not over as expected : [![enter image description here][6]][6] After a while and some lost hairs, I find the issue. Here is a simplified code : ```html
``` ([link codepen][7]) In the result, the orange square is behind the blue overlay and **this is because** the css properties `transform: translate3d...` and `transition: transform...` automatically added by fullpagejs. [![enter image description here][8]][8] Because theses properties, the property `z-index` is ignored ! If you remove theses problematics properties then the property `z-index` work well and the orange element become over the overlay as I want After somes searches and somes tries I don't find a way for have blocks elements inner a slide block and blocks elements over the overlay... Thanks for any help ! [1]: https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/ [2]: https://animejs.com/ [3]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/eREIW.png [4]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/YkY1I.png [5]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/6mr5A.png [6]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/KyZqD.png [7]: https://codepen.io/kegilkoo/pen/OJERXwb [8]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/O959O.png [9]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5472802/css-z-index-lost-after-webkit-transform-translate3d ### Versions Tested on Chrome and Firefox browsers

The website shows a set of slides (by means of fullpagejs), and I want to add an absolute overlay to the top of each slides. The height of the overlay must be increased if I scroll to the next slide, and the next slide, etc.. [![enter image description here][3]][3] v and if I swipe to the next slide v [![enter image description here][4]][4] The height of the overlay grows with an animation (with animejs). In some slides, I add some elements and sometimes, one of these element may be over the overlay. (by example the element A bellow) [![enter image description here][5]][5] But ! and this is my issue, the element A is behind the overlay, not over as expected : [![enter image description here][6]][6] After a while and some lost hairs, I find the issue. Here is a simplified code : ```html
``` ([link codepen][7]) In the result, the orange square is behind the blue overlay and **this is because** the css properties `transform: translate3d...` and `transition: transform...` automatically added by fullpagejs. [![enter image description here][8]][8] Because theses properties, the property `z-index` is ignored ! If you remove theses problematics properties then the property `z-index` work well and the orange element become over the overlay as I want After somes searches and somes tries I don't find a way for have blocks elements inner a slide block and blocks elements over the overlay... Thanks for any help ! [1]: https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/ [2]: https://animejs.com/ [3]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/eREIW.png [4]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/YkY1I.png [5]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/6mr5A.png [6]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/KyZqD.png [7]: https://codepen.io/kegilkoo/pen/OJERXwb [8]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/O959O.png [9]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5472802/css-z-index-lost-after-webkit-transform-translate3d ### Versions Tested on Chrome and Firefox browsers

comment.body:
This is not really a fullPage.js issue but probably a bug in the browser/s dealing with `translate3d` transformations and `z-index`.

See [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5472802/css-z-index-lost-after-webkit-transform-translate3d).

You can try some things like adding `transform-style: preserve-3d;`.

Another way to fix it is by creating the elements outside the fullPage.js structure.

And probably the simplest one, turning of `css3` transitions on fullPage.js by using `css3:false` or `scrollBar: true`.

issue.title: CSS Alternative

comment.body:
CSS snap is just a **single feature** within fullPage.js.
By taking a look at [the fullPage.js documentation](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/) you should be able to spot the difference :) 

One of the main differences is that fullpage.js is able to force the automatic slide of sections, while CSS snaps works on a free scroll and only animates once the user has ended up scrolling. This can lead to the user sliding multiple sections at the same time online with fullPage.js. It also creates a less-than-ideal scenario when using a mouse wheel instead of a trackpad to scroll.

Apart from that, fullPage.js is a well-tested component that comes with **plenty of features** that will **save you a TON of work** when working with a full-screen page.

Things like:

## [fullPage.js callbacks](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#callbacks).

Giving developers **total control** over when to trigger certain actions.
Things can be as complex as:

- If the user has been on section 1 let the user scrolls 3 times - using the mouse wheel - without triggering any animation (we might want to trigger our own in-slide effects), then scroll down and trigger the text animation 2 seconds after the user lands on it. Once done, disable scrolling up by mouse, trackpad, and keyboard. 
- When the user scrolls 150pixels within the scrollable, container of section 2, then move to section 5 and slide 3, and do it with no animation. 

## [fullPage.js methods](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#methods)

Allowing developers to trigger specific actions, such as moving to a specific horizontal slide within a vertical section, locking the scroll direction, the keyboard or setting responsive mode resulting in the free scroll, turning horizontal slides into vertical ones, or allowing sections to be bigger than he viewport only in this mode.

## [fullPage.js state classes](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#state-classes-added-by-fullpagejs)

fullPage.js comes with state classes out of the box. This means you can create CSS conditions to style or animate elements, or even use these classes to know the state your website is currently in.

Small details that will make your life way easier when creating a website. Things that you would have to create from the scratch otherwise.

## [fullPage.js options](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#options)

Offering thousands of possible combinations and saving a huge amount of time configuring things like:

- Horizontal arrows to slide right left.
- Navigation bullets & tooltips in sections and horizontal slides.
- Menu linked with sections
- Defining anchors on the URL (and making them linkable)
- Defining history behavior when going back/forward in browser history
- Defining the easing effect 
- Loop options / inifite scroll
- Keyboard scroll 
- Allowing scroll within overflowing sections
- Defining responsive thresholds 
- Lazy load
- And enabling plenty of [fullPage.js extensions](http://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/extensions/)

And all of them tied perfectly together, so for example, if scrolling is disabled, clicking on a menu item won't allow the user the scroll to that section, the URL anchor won't change, no callbacks will get fired etc.

### Additional out-of-the-box features

On top of that, fullPage.js allows you to:

- Play/pause media elements when entering/leaving a section.
- Define non-full-screen sections (larger or smaller, which by the way, [is a problem with CSS snaps](https://alvarotrigo.com/blog/why-not-to-use-css-scroll-snap/))
- Add mouse dragging, which is not even an option on CSS snaps.
- Define scrollable sections 
- Use a "normal page" after fullpage.js so once you are done with the full-screen sections you can have your usual page.
- fullPage.js automatically detects changes on the DOM and updates accordingly, without even needing to call any method or use any sophisticated framework.
- Detect the trigger that fired the scroll (trackpad, keyboard, bullet, menu, arrows...)

### Ready for frameworks

It's also available as a component for [jQuery](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/docs/#initialization-with-jquery), [React](https://alvarotrigo.com/react-fullpage/), [Vue](https://alvarotrigo.com/vue-fullpage/) and [Angular](https://alvarotrigo.com/angular-fullpage/).

Making it easier to track the state of the website on the JS side too.

### Ready for WordPress

It can also be added as a WordPress plugin for [Elementor](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-elementor/), [Gutenberg](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-gutenberg/), and soon [Divi](https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/wordpress-plugin-divi/) builders. 

It makes it super easy to integrate, configure and use any possible fullPage.js extensions.

----

So, as you can see, CSS snaps can be ok to perform certain kinds of websites, but it won't be offering the same fullPage.js. does.

fullPage.js is a component that **makes sure developers can focus on creating beautiful and completely functional websites** and not on the effect itself. 

It takes away from developers the task of creating such things from the scratch and making sure they are fully functional and compatible with all kinds of devices. 

If you need it or not, completely depends on your needs.

Height issues using Next.js
issue.body:
Hi there!

The only way I can get fullpage sections using Next.js is by setting my "sections" to 100vh.

This is causing issues with my app.

I've noticed that the correct height inlines in a style tag when dragging my responsive width around in chrome, but as soon as I let go, the height reverts to default.

Here are 2 sandboxes I found. 1 retains the correct height in its inline style tag and the other doesn't.

**Height is 100% without additional css**
https://codesandbox.io/s/8lpo68lp28?file=/src/index.js:859-913

**Height starts out correct but the inline styling vanishes after a second**
https://codesandbox.io/s/react-fullpage-js-example-forked-pxyrdw

I can't for the life of me figure out why that is (unless it's a version thing...)

Your help would be much appreciated!

comment.body:
You are loading the wrong version for the CSS file.
Replace this:

```html
	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="https://unpkg.com/fullpage.js@3.0.1/dist/fullpage.min.css">
``` 

For version 4.0.12

```html
	<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="https://unpkg.com/fullpage.js@4.0.12/dist/fullpage.min.css">
```

issue.title: Position TOC within article content - After first paragraph
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

It's common to find the table of contents after one or two introductory paragraphs. 
I believe this is yet not possible with this plugin.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

It'd be nice to be able to add on our markdown files some indicator of where we want the table to get added.
Something like

```markdown
paragraph
paragraph

{{ TOC }}

paragraph
paragraph
```

comment.body: Perhaps there's a way but creating a `addLiquidShortcode` and calling some of the plugin functions directly there?

issue.title: Elementor - Background Overlay Appearance Delayed When Scrolling (Safari)
issue.body:
### Description
During our testing Safari on Desktop and iOS is showing graphical bugs that don't appear on other platforms. 

VIDEO OF ISSUES: https://youtu.be/wd66gT6Nh4U

- Home Page: Background Overlays appear after a delay of coming into view. There is no animation applied to them.
- Flip Card's freak out on hover, no other way to describe it. You can see it in the "Engines" section on the home page and on the team members on the "About" page
- Games Page: Slider flashes white when scrolling
- Games Page: Lightbox background doesn't animate smoothly in when clicking on a game box art

These things seem to all be related to Safari's animation issues. I can mitigate some of the issues by using the "transform: translateZ(0)" hack, which I have done on the Flip Cards on the live site. It does not seem to work on the background overlays.

Are there any suggestions?

### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS
[Ideally in jsfiddle.net (https://jsfiddle.net/alvarotrigo/ea17skjr) or codepen.io (https://codepen.io/alvarotrigo/pen/NxyPPp), links to personal websites won't be reviewed unless isolated. Reported issues without a reproduction might get closed.]

### Steps to reproduce it
1. Enable Fullpage.js in Elementor
2. Add a background image to two sections
3. Add a gradient overlay over each section
4. Scroll between sections
5. Notice the background overlay doesn't appear until after a delay in Safari, but is fine on other browsers.

### Versions 
Safari 16, Mac OSX 12.6, reported on iOS as well (I don't have an iOS device.)

issue.title: Loading page with anchors shows wrong section/slide when using scrollOverflow
issue.body: When loading a page using URL anchors, the destination section/slide won't be the correct one due to fullpage.js focusing on the scrollOverflow element (or section/slide if there's none present).

issue.title: Loading page with anchors shows wrong section/slide when using scrollOverflow
issue.body: When loading a page using URL anchors, the destination section/slide won't be the correct one due to fullpage.js focusing on the scrollOverflow element (or section/slide if there's none present).

comment.body: Fixed in version 4.0.10! 🥳

issue.title: Android : Slider + Form inputs  + " fullpage_api.movex()" strange behavior
issue.body:
### Description

Hello, i bought a licence few months ago and played around your amazing plugin. Eveyrthing went well, i was able to achieve almost everything i needed/asked to.


Using 4.0.7 I had problem with blank screen issue on input focus (only on mobile), so i checked issues on github and saw people had the same one, and that the plugin got updated, i decided to upgrade to 4.0.11.


Now when i tried to make a single/multiple form using implemented slider, i have a really strange behavior, after filling the second input, i can't use fullpage_api.moveSlideLeft(); neither the arrows nor the nav 


## Tests & devices : fullpage.js v4.0.10
 
Desktop : As intended



lambdatest   : iphone12 emulator : as intended

android emulator : issue.
4  android phone : issue.

## fulllpage v4.0.7

Android : Weird input white screen/scrolling on input focus, but no issue with  fullpage_api.movex() after second input.
Desktop : As intended


### Link to isolated reproduction with no external CSS / JS


I tried to isolate this behaviour on a blank v4.0.11 

uploaded on personal hosting

https://gamx.fr/fullpagetestinput/examples/active-slide.html#secondPage/1


### Steps to reproduce it

On android : (if someone can test on real iphones and tell me if it's working as intended like on my emulator)

1.Fill an input (first or seconde slide , it dosen't matter.
2. Press Next/Prev 
3. It goes well.
4. fill the second input, press next/prev
5. everything is locked, button doesn't fire, nor the arrow keys or nav buttons


I hope this is a cronstructive issue and that i didn't miss something stupid 🗡️ 

I really appreciate  your work,. Thanks for taking a look at it :)

issue.title: Auto Height Section Issue When Auto Scrolling Off
issue.body:
Hi,

When `autoScrolling` is `false`, `min-height` conflicts with `height` in CSS when auto height is enabled on a section. So even if the section is auto height, it behaves as full height.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16402717/193471496-85de8cbd-dc78-4d11-ac1e-9a34c7e1af73.png)

https://codepen.io/meceware/pen/MWGGqLb

A solution might be solved with setting the CSS selectors as `:not(.fp-auto-height)`.

Thank you,

issue.title: Auto Height Sections Minimum Height Issue on Dev Branch
issue.body:
Hi,

I would like to ask, there was no `min-height` attribute in [`.fp-auto-height`](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/blob/3.1.2/dist/fullpage.css#L215) on the previous versions, but with the dev branch after `v4.0.11`, `min-height` attribute is added to `.fp-auto-height`.

I think this issue is related to [#4467](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467). In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

Thank you,

issue.title: Auto Height Sections Minimum Height Issue on Dev Branch
issue.body:

I think this issue is related to [#4467](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467). In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

Thank you,

issue.title: “scrollBar:true” impacts performance/FPS • fixed/sticky elements inside “fullpage” wrapper
issue.body:
Hi guys!

I’m using Webflow and creating a website for a client with FullPage.js.

I just wanted to ask why “scrollBar: true” impacts performance so much? FPS drops quite substantially. I’ve checked other websites with “scrollBar: true” like the demo one by Alvaro and another one that I’ll mention below.

That being said, the website is so smooth without “scrollBar: true”.

Is there a fix for the performance issues? Sadly, “position: fixed” doesn’t work inside “fullpage” wrapper without “scrollBar: true”. I needed it to create an animation.

Basically, I want the same “sticky” effect as in the “second” section of [this website (made in Webflow too)](https://beauty-hunter-project.webflow.io/). I’m really scratching my head here trying to understand how to create it :(

issue.title: Scroll back to to first section after page refresh
issue.body:
Hi there!

I have a Next.js build using custom validation to control the user's movement between sections. (it's a quiz)

The problem is that when the page is refreshed, all state data is lost breaking the dynamic content generated based on interactions in previous sections. I'd like it so that when the user refreshes their browser, they are returned to #Section1

I've tried the methods in the docs and they work momentarily after refresh, but then react-fullpage quickly slides back down to the side the user was on before refresh. I wonder if this is to do with the anchor tag in the URL?

Please help me understand what I'm missing here.

Cheers!

comment.body:
If you use anchors this shouldn't be an issue.

See this example and refresh when in other sections:
https://alvarotrigo.com/fullPage/#page2

issue.title: Auto Height Sections Minimum Height Issue on Dev Branch
issue.body:
Hi,

I would like to ask, there was no `min-height` attribute in [`.fp-auto-height`](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/blob/3.1.2/dist/fullpage.css#L215) on the previous versions, but with the dev branch after `v4.0.11`, `min-height` attribute is added to `.fp-auto-height`.

I think this issue is related to [#4467](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467). In my opinion, overriding `min-height` with `!important` should not be there, it conflicts when users set the minimum height for auto height sections. When this is overridden, the height gets auto no matter what the user sets, which imho what's intended with auto height sections.

Thank you,

comment.body:
> That's right! The new Elementor configuration adds the min-height directly to the section. It wasn't there before so the old versions work with both updates however with the latest Elementor update, min-height seems to conflict.

Right, now I get it :)

comment.body:
> I think this issue is related to https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js/issues/4467.

I think on this issue the user expects the `fp-overflow` element to take the height of the section, but that's not how it works right now. 
I believe that's an issue regarding the ScrollOverflow feature more than the `fp-auto-height`.

issue.title: Auto Height Section Issue When Auto Scrolling Off
issue.body:
Hi,

When `autoScrolling` is `false`, `min-height` conflicts with `height` in CSS when auto height is enabled on a section. So even if the section is auto height, it behaves as full height.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16402717/193471496-85de8cbd-dc78-4d11-ac1e-9a34c7e1af73.png)

https://codepen.io/meceware/pen/MWGGqLb

A solution might be solved with setting the CSS selectors as `:not(.fp-auto-height)`.

Thank you,

comment.body:
I haven't checked the page as I only check isolated reproductions here on Github.
But I the `fp-overflow` element is not suppose to be 100% height. 

If you want it to be 100vh, then add any element on it with such property `height: 100vh`.

The change you got on your page is totally normal as you are using a CDN that always loads the latest version, so your page can be subject to these kind of things.

issue.body:

comment.body:
@davITnemec you can use the fullPage.js option `scrollOverflow: false` to solve the issue if you are not planning on using scrollable sections with content larger than the viewport.

Otherwise, notice the `fp-overflow` is not a flex element and it's not taking 100% height of the viewport. 
So in this case you'll have to go another route.

I'd probably use an absolute positioned element to place the item on every bottom of the section.

comment.body:
Just use the same selector. Example: https://jsfiddle.net/h96bcz3f/1/ ```js new fullpage('#fullpage', { anchors: ['section1','section2', 'section3', 'section4'], menu: '.menu', } ``` ```html
  • Section 1
  • Section 2
  • Section 3
  • Section 4
  • Section 1
  • Section 2
  • Section 3
  • Section 4
```

issue.body:
I'm trying to set up fullPage.js with react, 

and I just did npm install:
 npm install @fullpage/react-fullpage

And when I try anything I'm getting these errors in vscode terminal:

Module Warning (from ./node_modules/source-map-loader/dist/cjs.js):
Failed to parse source map from 'C:\Users\istar\Desktop\fullpagereact-main\node_modules\@fullpage\react-fullpage\dist\easings.min.js.map' file: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:\Users\istar\Desktop\fullpagereact-main\node_modules\@fullpage\react-fullpage\dist\easings.min.js.map'

comment.body:
It's a warning, not an error. So you can actually ignore it.

I'll close this issue as it's a duplicate of [this other issue](https://github.com/alvarotrigo/react-fullpage/issues/344).

issue.title: Hide Navbar when scroll down, show again when scroll up
issue.body:
Project Status - Still in development - Local machine / local testing
Web Framework - Django
CSS Framework - Bulma
JS Packages / Plugins - fullpage.js

Testing on Chrome and Edge.

I'm currently updating our web-app, its Django and I already have a base.html template which contains the global html structure, links and navbar.

Your fullpage.js plugin is installed, configured and works. Everything shows and functions as it should on django's test server.

I want to hide the top navbar when the user scrolls down and then display it again when they scroll up again. This is usually a simple CSS/JS task however everything that I'm currently trying seems to be conflicting with the functions defined within fullpage.js.

I'm sure I'm not the first to ask this, so hopefully there's a solution that you can suggest?

Thanks

issue.title: Testing Fullpage.js
issue.body:
### Description
I've been testing Fullpage.js in React with no license key since I made a request for an open-source one but don't have it yet.
There's this watermark on the bottom right corner which does not appear on the examples provided (though they show no license key as well). I was wondering what's going on. Did the examples actually sport a license someway? Or is there a way to remove it (which is not CSS display/visibility)? Otherwise, will it just disappear once I receive my license key and I just have to wait?

I'm sorry I have to write about such a silly question but I found literally zero info about the issue.

Thanks.
